_comment: MCPorter MCP configuration snippets for various AI tools
_install: npx mcporter list (zero-install) | pnpm add mcporter | brew install steipete/tap/mcporter
_note: MCPorter can run as an MCP server (proxying other MCPs) or as a CLI tool for discovery, calling, and code generation

_usage_modes.mcp_server: Use 'mcporter serve' to expose all configured MCP servers through a single MCP server entry — reduces config sprawl
_usage_modes.cli_tool: Use 'mcporter list|call|generate-cli|emit-ts' directly from terminal for discovery, ad-hoc calls, and CLI generation

kiro._method: Command Palette: Kiro: Open user MCP config (JSON)

droid_command: droid mcp add mcporter "npx" -y mcporter serve

with_custom_config._description: Point MCPorter at a specific config file (any assistant — add --config flag to args)

with_verbose_logging._description: Enable verbose logging for debugging (any assistant — add --verbose flag to args)

mcporter_config_example._description: Example ~/.mcporter/mcporter.json — defines which MCP servers MCPorter proxies

cli_examples._description: MCPorter CLI usage (not MCP server mode — run these directly in terminal)
cli_examples.call_tool: npx mcporter call context7.resolve-library-id query='React docs' libraryName=react
cli_examples.config_add: npx mcporter config add my-server https://example.com/mcp

notes: MCPorter auto-imports configs from Cursor, Claude Code, Claude Desktop, Codex, Windsurf, OpenCode, VS Code
In MCP server mode ('serve'), MCPorter exposes all configured MCP server tools through a single entry point
Supports both stdio and HTTP MCP transports
Variable interpolation: ${VAR}, ${VAR:-fallback}, $env:VAR in headers and env
OAuth token caching is automatic under ~/.mcporter/<server>/
Daemon mode ('mcporter daemon start') keeps stateful servers warm between calls
